summary: The National Nuclear Security Administration has increasingly used support service contracts to carry out its mission. NNSA obligated about $193 million in FY 2018 for support service contracts (which include program management services and more). However, NNSA may not be effectively managing the risk that some of its contractors could perform inherently governmental functions—which federal contractors are not allowed to do. We recommended that NNSA...
title: Support Service Contracts: NNSA Could Better Manage Potential Risks of Contractors Performing Inherently Governmental Functions
